column1: a  A Type I barrier is built on a new highway project or a physically altered existing highway.
b  A Type II barrier is built to abate noise along an existing highway (often referred to as retrofit abatement) and is not mandatory.
c  All other types of barriers are nonfederally funded.
d  Have not been assigned a year of construction or a cost.
Miles of noise barriers can neither be assigned a year of construction nor a cost.
Miles of barriers, while assigned a year of construction, cannot be assigned a cost.

U.S. Department of Transportation, Federal Highway Administration, Office of Planning, Environment, and Realty, Summary of Noise Barriers Constructed by December 31, 2013 (Washington, DC: May 2016), available at http://www.fhwa.dot.gov/environment/noise/noise_barriers/inventory/ as of June 2016.
